description: 5 of 8 exports in src/model/actions/__testFixtures__/mockState.ts are now unused after dead action file removal: createMockGroup, createMockRelationship, createMockKeyframe, setupAnalyticsMock, setupConsoleSpy. title: Track project export events
description:
Project import tracks project_imported but export has no analytics.

The handleExport function in TopBar.tsx (line 86) builds a JSON blob and triggers a download. No trackEvent call.

Fix: Add trackEvent('project_exported', project) in handleExport, before the download trigger. The project object is already available in scope. No additional metadata needed beyond the standard project metadata (context_count, relationship_count, etc.) that trackEvent includes automatically.

title: ARCHITECTURE.md: update EditorState and component descriptions
description:
The EditorState interface and component descriptions in ARCHITECTURE.md are significantly incomplete:

EditorState interface (compare ARCHITECTURE.md lines 326-349 with src/model/storeTypes.ts lines 45-93):
- Missing selection states: selectedUserId, selectedUserNeedId, selectedUserNeedConnectionId, selectedNeedContextConnectionId, selectedStageIndex, selectedTeamId, selectedContextIds (multi-select array), hoveredContextId, isDragging
- Missing view options: showGroups, showRelationships, showIssueLabels, showTeamLabels, showRelationshipLabels, showHelpTooltips, groupOpacity, colorByMode ('strategic' | 'ownership')
- Missing temporal state: temporal object with currentDate, activeKeyframeId
- canvasView missing distillation viewport (see contextflow-w1y)
- ViewMode type missing 'distillation' (see contextflow-w1y)

Component layout section (lines 209-222):

- InspectorPanel selection routing only mentions context/relationship/group - missing user, userNeed, userNeedConnection, needContextConnection, stage, team selections

- Component tree missing overlay components (IssueLabelsOverlay, TeamLabelsOverlay, DistillationRegions)

title: Enrich store analytics metadata for delete/add events
description: The store's trackEvent calls for context_added, context_deleted, user_deleted, and user_need_deleted are missing useful metadata that the old (now-deleted) action files had. Add: context_type and ownership to context_added; relationship_count and group_count to context_deleted; connection_count to user_deleted; user_connection_count and context_connection_count to user_need_deleted. The project data is already in scope at each call site.

title: Track undo/redo usage
description:
The undo and redo actions in store.ts (lines 1030-1037) have no analytics. They delegate to Yjs UndoManager via getCollabUndoRedo().

Fix: Add undo_used and redo_used events. The Yjs UndoManager does not expose what action type was undone, so metadata is limited to a simple event fire. Do not attempt to track action_type or stack_depth; the underlying Yjs undo stack is opaque from the store layer.

This reveals how often users rely on undo/redo as a safety net.

title: Teams UI not surfacing in bounded context inspector
description:
CONFIRMED BUG. In a fresh project, there is no way to assign teams to bounded contexts.

The ContextInspector shows: Ownership (Our Team/Internal/External), Legacy, Big Ball of Mud, Role, Code size, Boundary, Notes, Issues, Relationships. No team assignment dropdown appears.

Additionally, the left sidebar with Repos/Teams tabs only appears when repos or teams already exist (e.g. in the ACME example project). In a new project, there is no sidebar and no way to create teams.

**Root cause investigation needed:**
- The team assignment dropdown code exists in ContextInspector.tsx (lines 207-234) but is not rendering
- Check if it's conditionally hidden when no teams exist in the project
- Check if the sidebar "Teams" tab with the "Add Team" button is hidden when the team count is 0
- The left sidebar (RepoSidebar/TeamSidebar) needs to be accessible even in empty projects so users can create their first team

**Key files:**
- `src/components/inspector/ContextInspector.tsx` lines 207-234 (team dropdown)
- `src/components/TeamSidebar.tsx` (team creation + sidebar tab)
- `src/components/RepoSidebar.tsx` (repo sidebar tab)
- `src/components/CanvasArea.tsx` (sidebar rendering logic)

**Acceptance criteria:**
- Team assignment dropdown visible in ContextInspector when teams exist
- Sidebar accessible in empty projects so users can create teams
- Creating a team and assigning it to a context works end-to-end

GH issue: https://github.com/virtualgenius/contextflow/issues/4

title: Repository assignment UI not visible in bounded context inspector
description:
CONFIRMED BUG. In a fresh project, there is no way to assign repos to bounded contexts.

The ContextInspector does not show any repo assignment section. The left sidebar with Repos/Teams tabs only appears when repos or teams already exist. In a new project, there is no sidebar and no way to create or assign repos.

Repo assignment works via drag-and-drop from the RepoSidebar in projects that already have repos (e.g. ACME example), but there's no way to get to the RepoSidebar in a fresh project.

**Root cause:** Same as contextflow-4is. The sidebar is conditionally hidden when no repos/teams exist, creating a chicken-and-egg problem: you can't create repos because the sidebar that lets you create repos isn't visible.

**Key files:**
- `src/components/inspector/ContextInspector.tsx` (repo display section)
- `src/components/RepoSidebar.tsx` (repo creation + drag-and-drop)
- `src/components/CanvasArea.tsx` (sidebar rendering logic)

**Acceptance criteria:**
- Sidebar accessible in empty projects so users can create repos
- Repo assignment via drag-and-drop works end-to-end from fresh project
- Assigned repos visible in ContextInspector

description:

Persistence and Behavior section (line 148):
- Says 'Local-first persistence: IndexedDB storage with Miro-style autosave' - should describe cloud-first persistence with Yjs/Cloudflare Durable Objects. IndexedDB is now only used for migration backup.

Canvas Behavior section (line 52):
- Says 'Autosave: Changes persist automatically to IndexedDB (Miro-like)' - should say changes sync to cloud automatically via Yjs.

Future UX Enhancements section (lines 162-171):
- 'Collaborative editing: Real-time multi-user editing with conflict resolution' listed as future but already implemented (Yjs CRDT + Cloudflare Workers). Remove from future list.
- 'Keyboard shortcuts overlay: Discoverable documentation for power users' listed as future but already implemented (KeyboardShortcutsModal.tsx, Cmd/Ctrl+?). Remove from future list.

Component Roles table (lines 125-134):

title: Track connection deletion events
description:
Connection creation events are tracked (user_need_connection_created, need_context_connection_created) but deletions are not.

Store actions with no analytics (store.ts):
- deleteUserNeedConnection (line 808): just calls getCollabMutations().deleteUserNeedConnection()
- deleteNeedContextConnection (line 845): just calls getCollabMutations().deleteNeedContextConnection()

Fix: Add user_need_connection_deleted and need_context_connection_deleted events in the store actions. Include entity_type and entity_id metadata to match the creation pattern.

Note: userActions.ts has deleteUserNeedConnectionAction and deleteNeedContextConnectionAction functions, but the store does not use them; it calls collab mutations directly. The tracking should go in the store actions.

title: ARCHITECTURE.md: update data model to match types.ts
description:
The data model code block in ARCHITECTURE.md is significantly out of date compared to src/model/types.ts. Key discrepancies:

Project interface:
- Shows obsolete Actor/ActorConnection; actual code uses User/UserNeed/UserNeedConnection/NeedContextConnection (4 interfaces replacing 2)
- Missing metadata fields: version, isBuiltIn, createdAt, updatedAt

BoundedContext interface:
- Still shows 'isExternal?: boolean' which NO LONGER EXISTS in types.ts. It was replaced by 'ownership?: ContextOwnership' where ContextOwnership = 'ours' | 'internal' | 'external'
- Missing new fields: businessModelRole ('revenue-generator' | 'engagement-creator' | 'compliance-enforcer' | 'cost-reduction'), isBigBallOfMud (boolean), teamId (string, direct team assignment orthogonal to repo ownership)

FlowStageMarker:
- Field name wrong: doc says 'label' but code uses 'name'
- Missing fields: description?, owner?, notes?

Other missing types:
- Issue interface (id, title, description?, severity) and issues field on BoundedContext
- ContextOwnership type
- User, UserNeed, UserNeedConnection, NeedContextConnection interfaces (replacements for Actor/ActorConnection)

title: Track view preference toggles
description:
Settings toggles give insight into how users customize their view but none are tracked.

Store actions with no analytics (store.ts):
- toggleShowGroups (line 855)
- toggleShowRelationships (line 861)
- toggleIssueLabels (line 867)
- toggleTeamLabels (line 873)
- toggleRelationshipLabels (line 879)
- toggleHelpTooltips (line 885)
- setGroupOpacity (line 902)
- setColorByMode (line 907)

Fix: Add a single view_preference_changed event in each action. Include preference_name (string enum) and new_value (boolean for toggles, string for colorByMode, number for opacity). These are all safe to track (no PII). Helps answer: which visual layers do users actually use?

title: Repos sidebar tab should show all repos, not just unassigned
description: The Repos sidebar tab only appears when unassigned repos exist. Teams tab shows all teams regardless. Make repos consistent: show all repos (assigned and unassigned) so the tab appears whenever any repos exist in the project. Key fix in App.tsx line 107-109: change hasUnassignedRepos to hasRepos. RepoSidebar will also need to show assigned repos (with their context indicated). GH issue: https://github.com/virtualgenius/contextflow/issues/6

title: Add Business Model Role field to bounded contexts
description: Add a businessModelRole dropdown to the BoundedContext entity and Inspector panel. Four options: revenue-generator, engagement-creator, compliance-enforcer, cost-reduction. This captures HOW a context contributes to the business, complementing the existing strategic classification (WHAT kind of domain). Include an InfoTooltip with educational content explaining each role, following the existing tooltip pattern (ConceptDefinition, respects showHelpTooltips). From DDD Crew Bounded Context Canvas V5.

title: Track share link generation
description:
The ShareProjectDialog component (src/components/ShareProjectDialog.tsx) lets users generate and copy collaboration links but has no analytics.

Key functions:
- getShareUrl (line 12): generates the share URL
- handleCopy (line 53): copies URL to clipboard

Fix: Add a single share_link_copied event in handleCopy. The share URL is generated on dialog open (not a separate user action), so tracking the copy is the meaningful signal. Include project metadata (pass project to trackEvent). Do NOT include the actual URL in the event (PII policy: no full URLs).

title: Track entity property update events
description:
Entity creation and deletion are well-tracked, but property updates are inconsistently covered. Context property changes ARE tracked via context_property_changed and trackTextFieldEdit in contextActions.ts. The same pattern should extend to other entity types.

Store actions with no update tracking:
- updateGroup (store.ts:512): group name, color, notes
- updateTeam (store.ts:615): team name
- updateUser (store.ts:696): user name, type (internal/external)
- updateUserNeed (store.ts:759): need text, visibility
- updateKeyframe (store.ts:1250): keyframe label, date
- updateFlowStage (store.ts:914): stage name, color
- updateUserNeedConnection (store.ts:813): connection properties
- updateNeedContextConnection (store.ts:850): connection properties

Implementation approach: Follow the contextActions.ts pattern:
- Use trackPropertyChange for enum/boolean changes (e.g., user type, need visibility)
- Use trackTextFieldEdit for text fields (PII-safe: char counts only, never actual text)
- Each update action receives an updates object; check which keys changed and track accordingly

PII rules apply: never track actual names, text content, or descriptions. Only track field_name, old/new char counts, and enum values.

title: Track group membership changes
description:
Group creation and deletion are tracked (group_created, group_deleted) but membership changes are not.

Store actions with no analytics (store.ts):
- removeContextFromGroup (line 528)
- addContextToGroup (line 533)
- addContextsToGroup (line 538)

All three just call getCollabMutations() with no tracking.

Fix: Add context_added_to_group and context_removed_from_group events. Include member_count (number of contexts in group after the change). Do NOT include group names or context names (PII policy). Use hashProjectId pattern if group_id is needed.

title: Track temporal mode toggle
description:
Temporal keyframe CRUD is tracked (keyframe_created, keyframe_deleted, keyframe_context_position_changed) but the act of toggling temporal mode on/off is not.

Store action: toggleTemporalMode (store.ts:1131)

Fix: Add temporal_mode_toggled event with enabled: true/false (the new state after toggle). This tells us adoption rate of the temporal feature. The project param is available in the action (project is fetched at line 1135).

title: Add first_relationship_added FTUE milestone
description:
The trackFTUEMilestone function defines first_relationship_added but it's never called. The other 3 FTUE milestones are all triggered from store.ts:

- first_context_added (store.ts:410, contextActions.ts:268)
- first_group_created (store.ts:504)
- second_view_discovered (store.ts:237)

Fix: Add trackFTUEMilestone('first_relationship_added', null) after the trackEvent call in addRelationship (store.ts:557). Note: addRelationship currently passes null for the project param; this is consistent with the existing pattern there.

title: Add Big Ball of Mud flag to bounded contexts
description: Add an isBigBallOfMud boolean field to BoundedContext, similar to isLegacy. When enabled, shows a visual badge on the context node (like the Legacy badge). Represents Eric Evans' strategic design pattern: a system with mixed models and inconsistent boundaries that needs isolation. Add to Inspector as a toggle alongside the existing Legacy toggle. Include an InfoTooltip explaining what BBoM means and why it matters (signals need for isolation/decomposition), following the existing tooltip pattern.

title: Temporal/evolution view button is broken
description:
Clicking the temporal button on the strategic view does nothing. Was working earlier this week (visible in a LinkedIn screenshot). Regression.

## Technical Context

The toggle button in TopBar.tsx calls `toggleTemporalMode()` which delegates to `getCollabMutations().toggleTemporal()`. The Yjs mutation in keyframeMutations.ts calls `getTemporalMap(ydoc)` which returns `null` if the temporal property doesn't exist in the Yjs document, causing the toggle to fail silently.

**Likely root causes (investigate in order):**
1. `getTemporalMap()` returning null for projects that lack an initialized temporal object
2. The collab mutation chain breaking somewhere between store → collabStore → Yjs

**Key files:**
- `src/components/TopBar.tsx` - temporal toggle button (only in strategic view)
- `src/components/TimeSlider.tsx` - timeline UI, renders when `project?.temporal?.enabled`
- `src/model/store.ts` - `toggleTemporalMode()` action
- `src/model/sync/keyframeMutations.ts` - `toggleTemporalMutation()`, `getTemporalMap()`

**Note:** KeyframeManager.tsx and KeyframeEditor.tsx exist but are never imported anywhere in the codebase. May be dead code or incomplete wiring.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Clicking temporal toggle in strategic view enables the TimeSlider at the bottom of the canvas
- Toggling off hides the TimeSlider
- Works for both new and existing projects

title: Bug: dragging contexts in Strategic/Distillation views does not auto-classify
description: Moving a context in Strategic view should auto-update evolutionStage (genesis/custom-built/product/commodity) based on x position. Moving in Distillation view should auto-update strategicClassification (core/supporting/generic). The logic exists in contextActions.ts moveContextAction (lines 113-126) using classifyFromStrategicPosition and classifyFromDistillationPosition, but this is dead code. The store's updateContextPosition just calls getCollabMutations().updateContextPosition() with no classification. The distillation view has partial logic in setViewMode (runs on view switch only, not during drag). Fix: add auto-classification to the collab mutation code path, likely in updateContextPosition or as a post-drag handler similar to completeFlowStageMove.

description: After exceeding the free tier Durable Objects limits (2026-02-26), upgraded to paid plan. Need to configure billing usage alerts in Cloudflare dashboard to avoid unexpected charges. Set up notifications for Workers, Durable Objects, and Pages usage thresholds.

description:
ARCHITECTURE.md was written when only two views existed (Flow and Strategic). Distillation View is missing everywhere:
- Overview says 'two synchronized projections' - should be three
- ViewMode type in EditorState section shows only 'flow' | 'strategic' - missing 'distillation'
- TopBar description says 'Toggle Flow View / Strategic View' - missing Distillation
- Canvas axes section missing Distillation View description. Actual axes per DistillationRegions.tsx: X-axis = Business Differentiation (low to high), Y-axis = Model Complexity (low to high), with quadrant regions (Generic, Supporting, Core)
- Canvas drag behavior section missing Distillation (allows independent 2D positioning via positions.distillation.x and positions.distillation.y)
- canvasView in EditorState missing distillation viewport

title: Audit and remove dead action functions superseded by collab mutations
description: The store was refactored to use collab mutations (getCollabMutations()) but the old action functions in src/model/actions/ still exist with stale trackEvent calls. context_added, user_added, user_need_added events were silently dropped because the store methods were the real code path. Audit all action files (contextActions.ts, userActions.ts, etc.) to identify which functions are dead code vs still called, and remove the dead ones. Single source of truth should be the store methods.
close_reason: Deleted 4 dead action files (contextActions, userActions, teamActions, temporalActions) plus their tests, removed unused userActions import from store.ts. 3,352 lines removed. projectActions, projectHelpers, and keyframeHelpers kept (still actively used).
